posts.post_content: @lorendorky I'd love to see the non-Alaran wedges. I feel like Golgari and Simic can play well together, and detain is only going work wonders with battalion. Borzhov also has potential, and Dimir's milling could potentially make a three color frites style reanimator more playable. RUG and WBG don't seem as viable, though.

posts.post_content:
Oh no guys, this isn't exactly like [Sanguine Bond](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sanguine Bond): This is better.  
  
See? "EACH opponent loses that much life". As in, by some chance that you are playing against 3 other players in EDH and you extort just once, each opponent will lose 4 life instead of one.  
  
So start seeing goofy mana-ramp ![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) EDH decks soon.

posts.post_content: Oh....oh my...I just realized that the guild mage's second ability scales with the number of players in a game when you pay an extort trigger. If I am in a 4 player game (me + 3 opponents), I trigger this girl here then cast a spell and pay a single extort trigger I end up gaining 3 life and all my opponent's lose 4 life. That's disgusting. I want 4.

posts.post_content:
Don't forget to cast that second ability multiple times, to double, triple(etc) it's effect and lead to victories even without [Exquisite Blood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Exquisite Blood) infinite-ness.  
   
Use [Crypt Ghast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crypt Ghast) for extra manas, Play [Obzedat, Ghost Council](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Obzedat, Ghost Council) and let him cycle out. Next turn you can pay (2)(B)(B)(W)(W) to trigger the 2nd ability of this card twice, in response to Obzee returning to the battlefield. You gain 2 life, which deals 4 dmg to your opponent. Obzedat can attack now and if you give it lifelink some more of your extra black manas and even if you get blocked they still take 10 dmg from you gaining 5 life. If they don't block they're at 1hp and i'm sure extort has proc'd before so that's probably game.   
  
Best guildmage imho, just super abilities and they're rightly costed. 5/5

Posted By: Bookmeister (1/24/2013 8:17:24 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: My word - that second ability is monstrous. Obviously very good with the new extort mechanic, but has anyone considered what this could do in a soul sisters/martyr deck? Most of those decks already run flagstones of trokair. Swap out 4 plains for 4 godless shrines (which can then be fetched with the flagstones), add in a few of these, plus maybe an immortal servitude or two. All your cards are still white for the purpose of martyr of sands, and the life gain that can be generated by that deck is enough to kill an opponent in a turn or two if you activate this. Maybe not main deck material, but sounds like a solid alternate win condition for the sideboard. Widening the decks mana base also gives access to tide hollow sculler and lingering souls. Awesome.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Don't forget to cast that second ability multiple times, to double, triple(etc) it's effect and lead to victories even without [Exquisite Blood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Exquisite Blood) infinite-ness.  
   
Use [Crypt Ghast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crypt Ghast) for extra manas, Play [Obzedat, Ghost Council](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Obzedat, Ghost Council) and let him cycle out. Next turn you can pay (2)(B)(B)(W)(W) to trigger the 2nd ability of this card twice, in response to Obzee returning to the battlefield. You gain 2 life, which deals 4 dmg to your opponent. Obzedat can attack now and if you give it lifelink some more of your extra black manas and even if you get blocked they still take 10 dmg from you gaining 5 life. If they don't block they're at 1hp and i'm sure extort has proc'd before so that's probably game.   
  
Best guildmage imho, just super abilities and they're rightly costed. 5/5
